'Is Shuri really okay...?'%K%P
The way she'd been acting had got me worried.%K%P
Was it all right to leave her on her own?\nIf I didn't do something to help her soon,\nit might be too late.%K%P
[Sorry it's so late.\nThere's something I need to ask you about.\nCan I call you?]%K%P
Maybe I was being paranoid, but I decided to\ntext Shuri anyway.%K%P
I didn't have to wait long for her reply.%K%P
[so hungry\nhelp]%K%P
[Are you at home?]%K%P
[park]%K%P
'Why's she still there?!'%K%P
I'd been right to worry after all.\nIn fact, I felt like I'd been too naive before.%K%P
If Shuri was at the park, she must have\nbeen practicing.%K%P
Had she not stopped since I saw her last?%K%P
All kinds of worst case scenarios started flooding\ninto my head.%K%P
I dashed out of the house and headed toward the park.%K%P
On the way I stopped at a convenience store\nto get some supplies.%K%P
'What is she thinking...?'%K%P
I bought whatever I saw and thought I'd need.\nJudging by her texts, Shuri was probably\nin pretty bad condition by now.%K%P
'Shuri!'%K%P
When I arrived I found Shuri sitting on a bench\nin a corner of the park.%K%P
'Yamato... You came...'%K%P
'What do you think you're doing here at this hour?!'%K%P
'Uh, just practicing...'%K%P
'Do you even know what time it is?\nIt's not safe for a girl to be out this late!'%K%P
'Oh... I... Sorry.'%K%P
'Right... I am a girl, aren't I...\nSometimes I forget.'%K%P
'Geez, get a hold of yourself.'%K%P
Shuri spoke like she didn't really know\nwhat she was saying.%K%P
'Here, I got some food and stuff.\nTake whatever you like.'%K%P
'Thanks, Yamato! I love you.'%K%P
'That's not the kind of thing you should go saying\nto just anyone.'%K%P
Normally Shuri would never say something like that.\nThe fatigue must have been getting to her.%K%P
'I know that. I'm... A girl, after all... Aren't I?'%K%P
She casually shrugged off my rebuke.%K%P
By now Shuri's attention was totally focused on\nthe idea of food as she intently rummaged through\nthe convenience store bag.%K%P
'I guess I'll take a rice ball, then.\nThis salmon one.'%K%P
'Sure, go ahead. Take your time and eat slowly.'%K%P
'Thanks.'%K%P
Judging by the way she tore into her rice ball,\nShuri must have been really starving.%K%P
As I watched over her, I once more got the feeling\nthat something wasn't right.%K%P
'...Seriously, what were you thinking?'%K%P
I spoke up after giving her some time\nto catch her breath.%K%P
'...Sorry if I scared you.'%K%P
'If you are, then stop pushing yourself so hard.\nIt's not just me, Kagura's worried about you too.'%K%P
'Really... Heh, she acts like such an airhead,\nbut she actually pays attention to what's going on.'%K%P
'Unlike me...'%K%P
Shuri stared absently at her half-eaten rice ball\nwhile muttering those self-depreciating words.%K%P
'Come on, it's not like you to talk like that.'%K%P
'Really? You don't think so?'%K%P
'But then... What is 'like me?'\nHow do people see Shuri Kisshouten?'%K%P
'Is that a question that you need people\nto tell you the answer to?'%K%P
Shuri was totally losing sight of herself.%K%P
She was usually so full of confidence, but now\nit seemed like she'd just been acting tough\nthe whole time.%K%P
'You're tired.\nYou should take a break.'%K%P
'No... I can't waste precious time just resting.'%K%P
'You need to take better care of yourself\nBECAUSE time is precious!\nYou look like you're about to keel over!'%K%P
Shuri's smile had vanished without a trace.%K%P
It wasn't just when her fans were around.\nEven in her daily life she seemed as if\nshe was reaching breaking point.%K%P
She'd never be able to carry on as a Divine Idol\nlike this.%K%P
'B-but, my sister...!'%K%P
'I have to help her, or else...'%K%P
'All of it will mean nothing if I can't pass this\naudition and join her in L☆SEVEN!'%K%P
Something had got Shuri really fired up.\nEverything she'd been bottling up burst out\nlike a blazing flame.%K%P
'If I don't get serious I won't even be a match\nfor Kagura. There's nothing special about me,\nso all I can do is keep practicing!'%K%P
'Kagura'd be mad if she heard you\nput yourself down like that.'%K%P
'Hey, Shuri... What's this really all about?'%K%P
Shuri's sister, Bishamonten, was already\na member of L☆SEVEN.\nWas she in some kind of trouble?%K%P
'My sister got angry at me...'%K%P
'She said I'd never make it as a Divine Idol,\nthat I should give up.'%K%P
'Did she say why...?'%K%P
'I think she worries because I'm too inexperienced.'%K%P
Shuri told me all about what happened\nbetween her and her sister.%K%P
And about how she was determined to pass the audition\nand do what she could to help Bishamonten.%K%P
'Do you understand now?'%K%P
'Well, I get why you'd think that way.\nBut practicing until you collapse won't help.\nThis is an issue of practicing efficiently.'%K%P
'I... I guess you're right.'%K%P
'You're going through some hard times, huh Shuri?'%K%P
'Yes...'%K%P
'Then ask someone for help.\nI'm right here, you know.'%K%P
'But I'd feel bad for Kagura...'%K%P
'Kagura said it herself.\nShe told me she'd be fine, and that\nshe wanted me to keep an eye on you.'%K%P
'Really...? Kagura said that? But, why...?'%K%P
'See? You've been pushing yourself so hard\neven your rivals want to help you.'%K%P
'I'm not saying you shouldn't give it your all.\nJust don't try to do everything alone.'%K%P
'You've got friends you can turn to,\nlike me and Kagura.'%K%P
Shuri was worried about the auditions,\nand about her sister.\nShe just had too many things weighing on her mind.%K%P
When it all got too much for her, that must have\nbeen when she got so obsessed with practice.%K%P
She'd been blinded to the fact that she was only\ndoing herself harm.%K%P
'...Would you really help me?'%K%P
'Of course. I want to do what I can to support you.'%K%P
'In that case...'%K%P
Shuri gently slumped against me.%K%P
'Kagura's my rival, so now you're the only one.'%K%P
'Let me lean on you a while.'%K%P
Shuri leaned in closer and buried her face\nin my shoulder.%K%P
Gripping my clothing tightly,\nshe started to let out quiet sobs.%K%P
'Uh... Uuuh...'%K%P
Shuri was crying.%K%P
Obviously she didn't want me to see.\nBut there was no way to hide it.%K%P
'I'm sorry, I didn't mean to cry...'%K%P
'I'm not watching, so cry as much as you like.'%K%P
'Mm... Thank you, Yamato...'%K%P
I looked away\nto give Shuri some sense of privacy.%K%P
'Wow, you can still see the stars even from\nhere in the city.'%K%P
Looking up, I could see several stars in the sky.%K%P
The stars weren't much to look at,\nbut they shone resolutely.%K%P
'I'll always be here for you, Shuri.'%K%P
'We'll do our best together.\nAnd you'll pass this audition.'%K%P
'Right...'%K%P
Shuri raised her head and joined me in\nlooking at the stars.%K%P
'There's a lot of them, huh?'%K%P
'We'd probably see a lot more if we went out\nto the countryside...'%K%P
'It's okay. I like it like this.'%K%P
'Right now, this kind of night sky is enough for me.'%K%P
'Let's watch the starts again together,\nwhen I've learned to shine even brighter'%K%P
'Sounds good. I'll look forward to it.'%K%P
'Me too.'%K%P
